stanza.line: Take all my loves my love yea take themall
What hast thou then more than thou hadstbefore
No love my love that thou mayst true lovecall
All mine was thine before thou hadst thismore
Then if for my love thou my love receivest
I cannot blame thee for my love thou usest
But yet be blamed if thou thy self deceivest
By wilful taste of what thy self refusest
I do forgive thy robbery gentlethief
Although thou steal thee all my poverty
And yet love knows it is a greatergrief
To bear greater wrong than hate known injury
Lascivious grace in whom all ill wellshows
Kill me with spites yet we must not befoes
